On Thu, 2004-09-02 at 18:02, Tom Emerson wrote:
> Kristinn Sigurdsson writes:
> > That would be implementation dependant.
> 
> Ah, OK. Understood. I wasn't placing things in the right context.
> 
> > For what Stack was talking about you just take the if-modified bit
> > in the headers into account. For the proposed Adaptive Revisiting
> > add-on it would be URI + content hash (possibly a weakened hash to
> > ignore trivial changes).
> 
> Well, for revisiting I would just use the If-Modified-Since header
> coupled with the date the URI was last visited, relying on the server
> to do the Right Thing here.

I'd like to see some data on whether servers actually do the Right Thing
there.  If their If-Modified-Since check is similar to what they used
for datestamp, there√∏s some room for improvement.  There's a number of
possible ways to predict change, and the best one is probably dependent
on your data.  For an idea on how to figure out the best one, see my
IWAW paper at http://netarkivet.dk/website/publications/Etags-2004.pdf. 
I'd love to see the procedure for finding best prediction strategy
tested on real-world data (maybe including the Size: attribute).

-Lars
